org.itemscript.core.util
Class StaticJsonUtil

java.lang.Object
  org.itemscript.core.util.StaticJsonUtil

public final class StaticJsonUtil
extends java.lang.Object

Utility methods for working with JSON values.

Author:
Jacob Davies
jacob@itemscript.org

Constructor Detail

StaticJsonUtil

public StaticJsonUtil()
Method Detail

arrayToObjectList

public static java.util.List<JsonObject> arrayToObjectList(JsonArray array)
Take the given JsonArray, and return a List corresponding to it, where any values that are not of type JsonObject will be null.

Parameters:
array - The JsonArray to process.
Returns:
A JsonArray of JsonObjects.

arrayToStringList

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> arrayToStringList(JsonArray array)
Take the given JsonArray, and return a List corresponding to it, where any values that are not of type JsonString will be null.

Parameters:
array - The JsonArray to process.
Returns:
A list of strings.

changedKeys

public static JsonObject changedKeys(JsonObject original,
                                     JsonObject updated)
Compare two JsonObjects; returns a new JsonObject containing a key for each key in the original JsonObject that was not present in the updated JsonObject, or that was changed, and a key for each key in the updated JsonObject that was not present in the original JsonObject. The values in the new JsonObject are undefined; only the presence or absence of a key is significant.

Parameters:
original - The original JsonObject.
updated - The updated JsonObject.
Returns:
A new JsonObject containing the changed keys between the original and updated objects.

joinArrayOfStrings

public static JsonString joinArrayOfStrings(JsonArray value)
Join a JsonArray containing only JsonString values into one JsonString.

Parameters:
value - The JsonArray.
Returns:
A new JsonString.

looksLikeJson

public static boolean looksLikeJson(Url url,
                                    java.lang.String contentType)
Test the supplied URL and Content-Type to see if they look like JSON. A pretty crude test - if the filename ends with .json, or the content type is application/json, text/json, or text/x-json, or application/x-javascript, we will treat it as JSON.

Parameters:
url - The URL of the resource.
contentType - The Content-Type string of the resource.
Returns:
True if the resource looks like JSON, false otherwise.

stringMapToObject

public static JsonObject stringMapToObject(JsonSystem system,
                                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> map)
Take a Map and return a new JsonObject corresponding to it, where keys in the original map will be keys in the JsonObject and values in the original map will be JsonString values in the JsonObject.

Parameters:
system - The associated JsonSystem.
map - The map containing strings.
Returns:
A JsonObject.

toHtmlJson

public static java.lang.String toHtmlJson(JsonValue value)
Convert the supplied JsonValue to a pretty-printed HTML representation, using the default color map.

Parameters:
value - The value to convert.
Returns:
An HTML string, or null if the value was a Java null.

toHtmlJson

public static java.lang.String toHtmlJson(JsonValue value,
                                          JsonObject colorMap)
Convert the supplied JsonValue to a pretty-printed HTML string, using the supplied color map.

Parameters:
value - The value to convert.
colorMap - The color map to use; see StaticJsonUtil for constants to use as keys in the map.
Returns:
An HTML string, or null if the value was a Java null.
